main event: A round, baseball-sized object with a yellow glow was spotted moving from the east to the west over Bremerton, Washington on December 8, 1953.
interesting points: The object was observed for 10-15 seconds, moving from 45 degrees in the east to 80 degrees in the west.
The object was seen above and beyond a hill near an observatory post at an elevation of around 800 feet.
The weather conditions at the time included high scattered clouds at 4,000 feet and low scattered clouds at 1/12 coverage.

The Air Technical Intelligence Center (ATIC) analysis indicated the object was likely a balloon released just before the sighting, but could not provide a more positive opinion due to the lack of a formal report on the sighting.
The report was from Project 10073, a Project Blue Book case file.
sighted object: Round, baseball-sized object with yellow glow
photographs: No photographs included in the report
